components.description: The letter P, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter P

components.description: The letter S, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter S

description: The Palestinian flag, which may show as the letters P and S on some platforms.
title: Flag: Palestinian Territories

emoji_net_data.definition: The Flag for Palestinian Territories emoji is a sequence of the ?? Regional Indicator Symbol LetÂ­ter P and ?? Regional Indicator Symbol LetÂ­ http://emojipedia.org/flag-for-palestinian-territories/
emoji_net_data.name: Palestinian Territories

bn:13778626a: From or in the countryside or connected with it.
Of, from or pertaining to the countryside (adjective).

bn:00108198a: Of, from, or pertaining to Palestine or the Palestinian people.
Of, from, or pertaining to Palestine and/or the Palestinian people.
Of or relating to the area of Palestine and its inhabitants
Of or relating to Palestine or Palestinians.

bn:00034960n: Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design

bn:00060277n: The Palestinian people, also referred to as Palestinians, are the modern descendants of the peoples who have lived in Palestine over the centuries, and who today are largely culturally and linguistically Arab due to Arabization of the region.
An inhabitant of Palestine or an Arab descending from that area.
A descendant of the Arabs who inhabited Palestine
Inhabitant of Palestine or Arab of Palestinian descent.

bn:00023236n: The collective body of a nation or state as politically organized, or as exercising political functions.
The territory of a nation, especially an independent nation state or formerly independent nation; a political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

Nations is often used synonymously with ethnic group, but although ethnicity is now one of the most important aspects of cultural or social identity for the members of most nations, people with the same ethnic origin may live in different nation-states and be treated as members of separate nations for that reason.
Political organisation with a centralized independent government
An organized political community, living under a government
Nation has various meanings, and the meaning has changed over time.
A state is an organized community living under one government.
A political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

A people permanently occupying a fixed territory bound together by common law, habits and custom into one body politic exercising, through the medium of an organized government, independent sovereignty and control over all persons and things within its boundaries, unless or until authority is ceded to a federation or union of other states.
The people who live in a nation or country
A politically organized body of people under a single government
A state is a nonphysical juridical entity of the international legal system that is represented by one centralized government that has supreme independent authority over a geographic area.
The geographic area under the control of a political state.

bn:00015109n: Canaan was, during the late 2nd millennium BC, a region in the Ancient Near East, which as described in the Bible roughly corresponds to the Levant, i.e. modern-day Lebanon, Palestine, Israel, the western part of Jordan and southwestern Syria.
Palestine is comprised of the region between the Mediterranean Sea and the banks of the Jordan River, plus various adjoining lands to the east and south.
Sunset, and the end of the day, also spelled Shalim
An historic region of the Middle East, roughly equivalent to Palestine.
The Holy Land, as a term used by Jews, Christians, and Muslims, is an area roughly located between the Jordan River and the Mediterranean Sea but also includes the Eastern Bank of the Jordan River.
An ancient country in southwestern Asia on the east coast of the Mediterranean Sea; a place of pilgrimage for Christianity and Islam and Judaism
Palestine is a geographic region in Western Asia between the Mediterranean Sea and the Jordan River.
The Promised Land is the land promised or given by God, according to the Tanakh, to the Israelites, the descendants of Jacob.
The region between the Mediterranean Sea and the Jordan River.

note: This emoji was found in merged_emojis_before_fluentui but not in FluentUI
